# LlamaIndex: The Data Framework for LLM Applications ðŸ¦™

**Supercharge your LLM applications with LlamaIndex, the leading framework for data augmentation and knowledge retrieval.**  [Learn more at the original repo](https://github.com/run-llama/llama_index).

[![PyPI - Downloads](https://img.shields.io/pypi/dm/llama-index)](https://pypi.org/project/llama-index/)
[![Build](https://github.com/run-llama/llama_index/actions/workflows/build_package.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/run-llama/llama_index/actions/workflows/build_package.yml)
[![GitHub contributors](https://img.shields.io/github/contributors/jerryjliu/llama_index)](https://github.com/jerryjliu/llama_index/graphs/contributors)
[![Discord](https://img.shields.io/discord/1059199217496772688)](https://discord.gg/dGcwcsnxhU)
[![Twitter](https://img.shields.io/twitter/follow/llama_index)](https://x.com/llama_index)
[![Reddit](https://img.shields.io/reddit/subreddit-subscribers/LlamaIndex?style=plastic&logo=reddit&label=r%2FLlamaIndex&labelColor=white)](https://www.reddit.com/r/LlamaIndex/)
[![Ask AI](https://img.shields.io/badge/Phorm-Ask_AI-%23F2777A.svg?&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://www.phorm.ai/query?projectId=c5863b56-6703-4a5d-87b6-7e6031bf16b6)

LlamaIndex (formerly GPT Index) is a powerful data framework designed to streamline the development of LLM (Large Language Model) applications. It provides the tools you need to connect your LLMs with your data, enabling more informed and context-aware responses.

**Key Features:**

*   **Data Connectors:** Ingest data from various sources, including APIs, PDFs, documents, and SQL databases.
*   **Data Structuring:** Organize your data with indices and graphs for efficient LLM interaction.
*   **Advanced Retrieval/Query Interface:**  Retrieve relevant context and generate knowledge-augmented outputs based on your data.
*   **Integration with Popular Frameworks:** Seamlessly integrates with frameworks like LangChain, Flask, Docker, and ChatGPT.
*   **Modular Design:** Offers flexibility for both beginners and advanced users, with high-level APIs for ease of use and low-level customization options.

LlamaIndex is built with two primary packages:

1.  **Starter Package:**  `llama-index` - Includes core LlamaIndex and a selection of integrations.
2.  **Customized Package:**  `llama-index-core` - Core LlamaIndex with the flexibility to add your desired integrations from [LlamaHub](https://llamahub.ai/).

### Core Concepts

LlamaIndex is structured to utilize a core package combined with optional integration packages. This means imports typically follow this pattern:

```python
from llama_index.core.xxx import ClassABC  # Core submodule
from llama_index.xxx.yyy import SubclassABC  # Integration package
```

## ðŸš€ Overview

**Note:** Refer to the [official documentation](https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/) for the most up-to-date information.

### The Problem: Augmenting LLMs with Private Data

*   LLMs excel at generating knowledge and reasoning based on public data.
*   The challenge lies in effectively integrating LLMs with your private data.

### The Solution: LlamaIndex - Your LLM Data Framework

LlamaIndex provides a complete toolkit for building LLM applications:

*   **Data Ingestion:** Connectors to bring in data from various formats (APIs, PDFs, databases, etc.).
*   **Data Structuring:** Options to structure data (indices, graphs) for efficient LLM usage.
*   **Advanced Retrieval:** An intuitive query interface to retrieve context and generate knowledge-augmented output.
*   **Application Integration:**  Easy integration with existing application frameworks.

## ðŸ’¡ Contributing

Contributions are highly encouraged! See the [Contribution Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md) for details.

## ðŸ“„ Documentation

Comprehensive documentation is available [here](https://docs.llamaindex.ai/en/stable/)

## ðŸ’» Example Usage

```bash
# Install core and selected integrations
pip install llama-index-core
pip install llama-index-llms-openai
pip install llama-index-llms-replicate
pip install llama-index-embeddings-huggingface
```

**Example:**

```python
import os

os.environ["OPENAI_API_KEY"] = "YOUR_OPENAI_API_KEY"

from llama_index.core import VectorStoreIndex, SimpleDirectoryReader

documents = SimpleDirectoryReader("YOUR_DATA_DIRECTORY").load_data()
index = VectorStoreIndex.from_documents(documents)
```

**(More comprehensive example usage can be found in the documentation)**

## ðŸ”§ Dependencies

LlamaIndex uses poetry as the package manager. Dependency information can be found in the `pyproject.toml` file within each package's folder.

```bash
cd <desired-package-folder>
pip install poetry
poetry install --with dev
```
